intro: Xanthophyllum griffithii subsp. griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's goldenrods, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to golden inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
